Topic.Title: FREE GEORGE ZIMMERMAN FROM THIS ABSURD RACIAL CIRCUS TRIAL

Message.Msg: Hey liberty, I don't know why you think this all happened in the span of 5 seconds. A boxing round lasts 3 minutes, and heavyweights throw maybe 50 punches each, but they gotta protect and not just throw, ya know. The guy who dialed 911 caught the tussle and beatdown in progress at the point where it moved from grass to sidewalk. He observed it briefly before the moved, called out that he was gonna call 911. That's when he heard GZ call for help (as stated in court today). Then he ran to the phone, heard the shot right before they answered. That sounds like a good solid minute when you add the initial scuffle getting his attention (nobody runs to the door in a high crime neighborhood), the period he observed which included movement from grass to sidewal, the words he attempted to stop the fight with, and the time to get to the phone, make the decision to really dial 911, and then hear the gunshot. If two fat pros can throw 100 punches on equal footing in 3 minutes while protecting themselves, one cowardly thug can do more than a couple of sucker punches to a guy he's pinned down in two different spots in a guy's lawn.

Message.Msg: "It takes just one legislator to end the impromptu remarks. Rep. Daryl Metcalfe was one of the House Republicans who objected. "I did not believe that as a member of that body that I should allow someone to make comments such as he was preparing to make that ultimately were just open rebellion against what the word of God has said, what God has said, and just open rebellion against God's law," said Metcalfe, R-Butler. We're citing "rebellion against God's law" as a reason to prevent state legislators from speaking to the body? I think Daryl Metcalfe is going for an American Taliban merit badge on that one. Metcalfe is, to use the technical political term for it, a Known Jackass. We can add to this that he either (1) does not actually know how government works or (2) believes it should work differently, with only people who believe in his version of "God's law" being able to speak at all, both of which are also staples of the movement that elects people like him: What a nice touch." Message.Title: Latino Gang member to die for hate-crime murder of Cheryl Green
Message.Msg: LOS ANGELES (KABC) -- A Latino gang member was sentenced to death on Friday for the hate-crime murder of Cheryl Green, who was just 14 years old at the time. On the day she was killed, Police say Latino gang members were looking for any black person to shoot. Jonathan Fajardo showed no emotion when the judge sentenced him to death and over 200 years in prison. "I tried to have some compassion for him, but ... he's like a monster," said Charlene Lovett, Green's mother. Last September, a jury found the 22-year-old guilty of first-degree murder in the December 2006 shooting death of the eighth grader. Fajardo, 18 at the time, opened fire on a group of blacks in the Harbor Gateway area. Police say that he targeted the group because they were black. The killing sparked an outcry of protest from community members and elected officials. "I thought those days were over with," Lovett said. Related Content Story: Death recommended in Cheryl Green's murder Fajardo was also convicted and sentenced to death for the stabbing death of 25-year-old Christopher Ash, a potential witness, nearly two weeks after Green's murder. Fajardo was eligible for the death penalty on the special circumstance of multiple murder, committing a hate crime basd on race and committing the crime for a gang. Authorities say he is a part of the 204th Street gang. The victim's family said they are relieved that justice has finally been served. "She'll always be with us, and I'm just glad that this part is over with," said the victim's grandmother Marlene Townes. "We can finally move forward."
